Hurry! Apply Soon!                   Project DCLT Welcomes You to Spring 2015!       Join us for another exciting spring of Friday Night Forums and Dual Language Workshops for Chinese Language Teachers    Enter your school in the 2014-15 Rock That Movie  video competition. More than 150 middle and high school students from 7 schools entered more than 20 videos in the 2013-14 event.     Get new ideas for teaching from events held at The New York Chinese Characters Festival , which attracted hundreds of participants from many schools .    Don't forget to check out the 2015 NYU StarTalk Immersion Training Program for Teachers of Chinese (1-6) . Read the eight stories developed during the 2013 StarTalk program here . View stories from 2014 here !    Check out our Recent Events page for information about past events, conferences, and TV interviews!       Spring 2015 Friday Night Forums    April 24, 2015: Joy of Chinese Characters: Writing and Teaching    Special presenter, Zhonghua Pang, famous calligrapher, educator and poet. Mr. Pang will make a presentation named Joy of Chinese Characters: Writing and Teaching during the DCLT forum. Click here for more detail and how to register! 庞中华，著名书法家、教育家和诗人，是当代中国硬笔书法事业的主要开拓人。他开创的现代硬笔书法，深受人民大众喜爱，被誉为“中国硬笔书法第一人”。他多 次在中国中央电视台、中国教育电视台举办《庞中华硬笔书法讲座》，听众以数千万计，掀起中国硬笔书法的热潮。他独树一帜的“快乐立体教学法”，在国内及日 本、美国、德国、俄罗斯、东南亚、土耳其等地的学校、机关、社团以及联合国总部等演讲数千场，影响深远。 In addition, we will hold the Spring Swap Shop: Assessment to discuss various assessments methods that address the 4 skills or 3 modes of communication (interpretive, interpersonal, and presentational). Daisy Guo from Henry Street School will be presenting on Performance based Formative Assessment. A few student teachers will also be sharing their favorite assessments. The Project for Developing Chinese Language Teachers (DCLT)    Project DCLT, of New York University's Steinhardt School of Culture, Education, and Human Development , funded by the Freeman Foundation, was established in 2007 to provide services and support to Chinese language teachers, schools and school districts, and students in NYU's degree programs for Chinese teachers... Learn More>    Where are our Graduates?    Graduates of NYU teach in schools across New York and the country. NYU's Master's in Teaching Foreign Language (Chinese) program prepares them for certification and teaching.
